column2: The Amazon battle armor was created by the Magistracy of Canopus. Based on the standard Inner Sphere battle armor, the Amazon uses advanced armor to increase protection and provides a jump capability of 90 meters. This allows Amazon-equipped troops to clear obstacles that would stop other battle armor units. The Amazon is used by both the Magistracy and the Capellan Confederation. Amazons deployed by the Capellan Confederation Armed Forces faced Cavalier battle armor and turned in a better performance. Quirk: Armored Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.94 ---- The Amazon battle armor was created by the Magistracy of Canopus. column2: This Dark Age version of the Black Knight uses a Light Engine to reach a top speed of 54 km/h. It also has an advanced Endo-Composite skeleton protected by thirteen and a half tons of armor. Seventeen Clan-spec double heat sinks keep heat load under control. The right arm carries a Medium Shield, and it has an advanced Targeting Computer. Its weaponry is all Clan-spec. An ER PPC, two ER Large Lasers, two ER Medium Lasers, two ER Small Lasers and twin Small Pulse Lasers arm the Black Knight. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15 ---- This Dark Age version of the Black Knight uses a Light Engine to reach a top speed of 54 km/h. column2: An upgrade of the Blackjack BattleMech, the Blackjack OmniMech is a powerful and adaptable medium weight workhorse. Much like the Firestarter OmniMech, the genesis of the omni-Blackjack stems from the Combine's technology exchange program during the initial Clan Invasion with Ceres Metals Industries ' St. Ives Compact branch offering Luthien Armor Works specifications and licences to manufacturer the ill-regarded Blackjack. Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99 ---- An upgrade of the Blackjack BattleMech, the Blackjack OmniMech is a powerful and adaptable medium weight workhorse. Much like the Firestarter OmniMech, the genesis of the omni-Blackjack stems from the Combine's technology exchange program during the initial Clan Invasion with Ceres Metals Industries ' St. Ives Compact branch offering Luthien Armor Works specifications and licences to manufacturer the ill-regarded Blackjack. column2: The Bushwacker was originally a failed BattleMech designed to have a smaller forward profile to make the 'Mech a harder target to hit. The Bushwacker's unique design caused problems with the engine shielding, the side-effects of which manifested themselves as various gremlins in the 'Mech's on board electronics on the prototypes fielded. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05 ---- The Bushwacker was originally a failed BattleMech designed to have a smaller forward profile to make the 'Mech a harder target to hit. column2: Originally a FrankenMech produced with components sourced from 3 different Mechs, the 70 ton Cataphract entered Cappellan service in 3025. Powered by a 280 rated Fusion Core, the Cataphract 5L is armoured in Reflective Armour. Armed with a Gauss Rifle and an ER PPC, the Cataphract 5L mounts a pair of Medium lasers and a pair of Small VSPL’s for close combat. Quirk: Protected Actuators Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1 ---- Originally a FrankenMech produced with components sourced from 3 different Mechs, the 70 ton Cataphract entered Cappellan service in 3025. column2: The Catapult II retains the original's movement, jump capabilities and has a half ton more armor protection than its predecessor. The Catapult's most notable weapons are its two TSEMP Cannons mounted in the side torsos, which allow it to potentially disable an enemy 'Mech. Serving as back up are more conventional weapons, a pair of Diverse Optics Sunfire Extended Range Medium Lasers that are located in the center torso. A Chameleon Light Polarization Suite is integrated into the chassis aswell. Quirk: Accurate Weapon - Missiles Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14 ---- The Catapult II retains the original's movement, jump capabilities and has a half ton more armor protection than its predecessor. column2: The Catapult II retains the original's movement, jump capabilities and has a half ton more armor protection than its predecessor. Introduced a year after the base model in 3136, the advanced L7L is designed as a more conventional Capellan design with enhanced armor. The 'Mech trades in all its base weaponry for two Plasma Rifles mounted in each of the side torsos, and two 9-tube Multi-Missile Launchers. The design's most noted feature is its Heat-Dissipating Armor, which offers the variant greater resistance to heat related attacks. Quirk: Accurate Weapon - Missiles Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14 ---- The Catapult II retains the original's movement, jump capabilities and has a half ton more armor protection than its predecessor. column2: Based on the Reptar MiltiaMech, the Cazador is a redesigned Clantech upgrade. Sharing the same chassis, the designers took advantage of the Imperios improved manufacturing facilities to fully upgrade the lacklustre MiltitaMech. Replacing the industrial components of the Reptar, the Cazador has a 175 rated Fusion Core and an Endo Steel skeleton, allowing for the installation of a Supercharger. The Cazador is armed with an LB-10X and a pair of Small Pulses Lasers. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04 ---- Based on the Reptar MiltiaMech, the Cazador is a redesigned Clantech upgrade. Sharing the same chassis, the designers took advantage of the Imperios improved manufacturing facilities to fully upgrade the lacklustre MiltitaMech. Replacing the industrial components of the Reptar, the Cazador has a 175 rated Fusion Core and an Endo Steel skeleton, allowing for the installation of a Supercharger. The Cazador is armed with an LB-10X and a pair of Small Pulses Lasers. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04
column3: Cazador представляет собой переработанное и обновлённое в соответствии с технологиями кланов, шасси меха ополчения Reptar. Применив ту же конструкцию разработчики использовали продвинутые производственные мощности Escorpion Imperio, для того чтобы полностью модернизировать нежизнеспособный мех ополчения. В замен промышленных компонентов Reptar были установлены Fusion Core с рейтингом 175 и шасси Endo Steel с возможностью установки Supercharger. Cazador вооружен LB-10X и парой Small Pulses Lasers. Склонность: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

column2: Brawler
column3: Борец

column2: Based on the Reptar MiltiaMech, the Cazador is a redesigned Clantech upgrade. Sharing the same chassis, the designers took advantage of the Imperios improved manufacturing facilities to fully upgrade the lacklustre MiltitaMech. Replacing the industrial components of the Reptar, the Cazador has a 175 rated Fusion Core and an Endo Steel skeleton, allowing for the installation of a Supercharger. The Cazador is armed with an LB-10X and a pair of Small Pulses Lasers.
column3: Cazador представляет собой переработанное и обновлённое в соответствии с технологиями кланов, шасси меха ополчения Reptar. В замен промышленных компонентов Reptar были установлены Fusion Core с рейтингом 175 и шасси Endo Steel с возможностью установки Supercharger. Cazador вооружен LB-10X и парой Small Pulses Lasers.

column2: The Centurion OmniMech was born out of a desire on the part of Corean Enterprises to expand the company's market share. Manufactured primarily at the Corean Enterprises' site on New Avalon and weighing in at 50 tons, the Centurion mounted a Magna 250 XL engine, allowing it to run at 86 km/h, and mounts nine and a half tons of standard armor. With ten fixed double heat sinks, the Centurion has 24 tons of pod space available, almost half the total weight of the 'Mech, and the most common variants of the Centurion echo the various variants of the original Centurion BattleMech developed over the centuries. Quirk: Easy to Pilot Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99 ---- The Centurion OmniMech was born out of a desire on the part of Corean Enterprises to expand the company's market share. column2: A Dark Age upgrade of the Centurion 9H, the 9H3 replaces the primitive engine with a standard Fusion Engine and upgrades the armour to Ferro Fibrous; giving it comparable protection to a Succession Wars era Centurion. The freed weight is used to upgrade the LB-10X to a UAC/10. Quirk: Easy to Pilot Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.79 ---- A Dark Age upgrade of the Centurion 9H, the 9H3 replaces the primitive engine with a standard Fusion Engine and upgrades the armour to Ferro Fibrous; giving it comparable protection to a Succession Wars era Centurion. column2: A Dark Age redesign, the Commando 9S is a long ranged harasser. Based on the earlier 8S model, the 9S replaces the entire weapons loadout. A pair of MML 3’s sit in the side torsos, supported by an arm mounted Light PPC. 2 SRM 2’s provide additional fire power if an attacker closes in. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.98 ---- A Dark Age redesign, the Commando 9S is a long ranged harasser. Based on the earlier 8S model, the 9S replaces the entire weapons loadout. column2: Designed as a successor to the Wolverine, the Conjurer is a 50 ton Mech seen in Clan Second Line formations. Powered by a 250 rated XL Engine, the Conjurer HND-8 mounts 5 Jump jets and MASC. An Inner Sphere RAC/5 makes up the bulk of the HND-8’s weapons, with a pair of Medium Pulse Lasers and a Streak SRM-6 for close combat. Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1 ---- Designed as a successor to the Wolverine, the Conjurer is a 50 ton Mech seen in Clan Second Line formations. column2: Powered by a 200 rated XL Engine and mounting MASC, the 20 ton Fire Moth is one of the fastest Mechs ever created. Designed for scouting and as an Elemental transport, the Fire Moth entered production in 2874. A combination of Ferro Fibrous and Endo Steel give the Fire Moth 7.5 tons of Pod Space. The Fire Moth I is armed with an ER Large Laser, an Improved Heavy Small Laser and an LRM-5. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.98 ---- Powered by a 200 rated XL Engine and mounting MASC, the 20 ton Fire Moth is one of the fastest Mechs ever created. column2: Capable of reaching speeds of 87 km/h with it’s MASC activated, the Executioner is a fast 95 ton Clan OmniMech. Powered by a 380 rated XL Engine, the Executioner has 26.5 tons of pod space. The MASC and 4 Jump Jets are hardwired into the chassis. The Executioner EXE-J is armed with a HAG/40. For shorter ranges, the Executioner J has a trio of SRM-6’s. column2: Originating after the 17th battle of Hesperus II, the Fafnir II is the designation given to a limited production run of custom Fafnir's created with battlefield salvage. Built by Defiance Industries, the 100 ton Fafnir II FNR2-5-A is powered by a 300 rated Light Engine and protected by 21 tons of Ferro-Lamellor armour. A pair of HAG/30's form the primary armament, with 4 ER Medium Lasers for close range combat. A Targeting Computer improves the Mechs accuracy. Quirk: Stable Weapons Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18 ---- Originating after the 17th battle of Hesperus II, the Fafnir II is the designation given to a limited production run of custom Fafnir's created with battlefield salvage. column2: Developed as a complement to the Griffin in the later years of the Jihad, the Ghost is a medium strike 'Mech that saw considerable use in the years after the formation of the Republic of the Sphere. Developed by the Lyran Commonwealth and elements of the former Free Worlds League the Ghost carries an extensive array of electronic warfare equipment into combat. A Beagle Active Probe allows the Ghost to find enemy units, while Stealth Armor and a Guardian ECM Suite allows the 'Mech to live up to its name. With excellent land speed and formidable medium-range weaponry, the Ghost is ideal for hunter-killer and heavy raiding missions, especially when paired with Griffins.Another variant introduced in 3133 removes the SRM-6 rack from the standard Dark Age Ghost and replaces it with a Chainsaw to minimize logistical needs, or potentially to disguise it as an IndustrialMech. Quirk: Improved Sensors Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.06 ---- Developed as a complement to the Griffin in the later years of the Jihad, the Ghost is a medium strike 'Mech that saw considerable use in the years after the formation of the Republic of the Sphere. column2: The Götterdämmerung is a Heavy class BattleMech first fielded by the Lyran Commonwealth in 3138, the 'Mech's German name translates to twilight of the gods or ragnarök. The Götterdämmerung's durability is due in part of layers of Heavy Ferro-Fibrous Armor, while Blackstone would move the cockpit of the 'Mech to the torso. The Torso-Mounted Cockpit's ejection system is highly complex, making escape from the Götterdämmerung difficult under certain circumstances. MechWarriors piloting the 'Mech need also be wary of losing their side torsos, due to the split placement of their life support systems. column2: The G configurations main purpose is to be mobile enough to scout forward locations and still being able to deal with unexpected infantry troops. To achieve this the pod-based loadout includes 5 Micro Pulse Lasers and 4 Medium Pulse Lasers. The addition of a Watchdog CEWS electronics suite ensures the configuration is able to scout enemy forces without being easily detected. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04 ---- The G configurations main purpose is to be mobile enough to scout forward locations and still being able to deal with unexpected infantry troops. column2: A refit fielded by the Wolf Empire and sold by the Sea Foxes, the Griffin C is a standardised refit package designed to bring captured Inner Sphere Griffins up to Clan spec. Swapping the standard 275 core for a 330 rated one significantly improves the ground speed and allows for the installation of 9 Improved Jump Jets; virtually doubling the mechs jump range. Swamping the standard PPC for a clan spec ER alternative and the LRM rack for a smaller Streak 10 allows the Griffin to strike at almost any range. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.11 ---- A refit fielded by the Wolf Empire and sold by the Sea Foxes, the Griffin C is a standardised refit package designed to bring captured Inner Sphere Griffins up to Clan spec. column2: The first OmniMech both designed and built by the Lyran Alliance. The inspiration for the Hauptmann is drawn from the Daishi OmniMech used by the Clans. Using information from captured Daishis and data gleaned from the construction of the Firestarter OmniMech, which was shared by the Draconis Combine, the end result is a powerful OmniMech capable of defending itself in most combat situations. The Hauptmann is built on a standard chassis and powered by a 285 fusion engine, adding to the 'Mech's durability as it cannot be killed by a side torso loss. The Hauptmann has eleven double heat sinks fixed on the chassis and can add more if needed in its various configurations. For protection, the Hauptmann carries eighteen and a half tons of armor and has CASE fixed in the right torso to protect against an ammunition explosion. Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.12 ---- The first OmniMech both designed and built by the Lyran Alliance. column2: A 3050's era design, the Hecatoncheires is the FWL's attempt to produce a dedicated heavy scout suitable for the modern battlefield. Based on a previously rejected redesign of the venerable Cyclops, the Hecatoncheires downsizes the classic cyclops to 65 tons in weight. A Beagle Active probe, paired with a C3 unit make up the mechs specialist electronics. 4 Medium Lasers and a pair of SRM-6's with Artemis IV provide a nasty punch at close range, while a Gauss Rifle covers longer ranges. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09 ---- A 3050's era design, the Hecatoncheires is the FWL's attempt to produce a dedicated heavy scout suitable for the modern battlefield. column2: Built to command BC3 equipped lances, the Hecatoneires 6Cm is a minor upgrade to the 6C model. The Streak LRM-15 is downsied to a smaller SLRM-10 with the loss of a ton of ammo. The remaining ton is moved to a new ammo bay located below the cockpit, a source of consternation for some pilots. With the freed weight and space, a Boosted C3 Master computer is mounted in the Left torso. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09 ---- Built to command BC3 equipped lances, the Hecatoneires 6Cm is a minor upgrade to the 6C model. column2: A 65 ton design which emphasises overwhelming firepower over speed or armour, the Hellbringer is a Clan OmniMech. Powered by 325 rated Xl Engine, the Hellbringer has 28.5 tons of pod space. The Hellbringer T is armed with a pair of ER PPC’s and an ATM-6. 3 ER Medium Lasers and a pair of AP Gauss Rifles cover close range combat. AMS protects the Hellbringer T from missiles while CASE II protects the munitions bay. Quirk: Integrated Searchlight Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1 ---- A 65 ton design which emphasises overwhelming firepower over speed or armour, the Hellbringer is a Clan OmniMech. column2: A Nova Cat design, the 50 ton Huntsman was designed for Operation Revival and the invasion of the Inner Sphere; first entering production in 3049. An OmniMech, the Huntsman is built around a 250 rated XL Engine with an Endo Steel Skeleton and Ferro Fibrous armour giving the OmniMech, 21.5 tons of pod space. 5 Jump Jets are fixed to the chassis, giving the Huntsman additional flexibility. The Huntsman F is armed with an Improved Heavy Large Laser and a pair of Artemis V enhanced LRM-15’s. A pair of ER Medium Lasers provide additional firepower at close range. A Targeting Computer enhances the weapons accuaracy. \n\n Quirk: Stable Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05 ---- A Nova Cat design, the 50 ton Huntsman was designed for Operation Revival and the invasion of the Inner Sphere; first entering production in 3049. column2: A Nova Cat design, the 50 ton Huntsman was designed for Operation Revival and the invasion of the Inner Sphere; first entering production in 3049. column2: First produced in 2948, the Ice Ferret is a medium scout OmniMech often employed as a head hunter or strike unit. A 45 ton Clan OmniMech, the Ice Ferret is powered by a 360 rated XL Engine and has 9.5 tons of pod space thanks to a combination of Endo Steel, an XL Engine and Ferro-Fibrous. The Ice Ferret IFR-K is armed with a Large Pulse Laser, an ER Small Laser and a pair of ER Medium Lasers. Laser AMS improves the Ice Ferrets defensive capabilities. column2: Relatively lightly armed for a heavy BattleMech, the Jade Hawk is equipped only with four Series 1g ER Small Lasers and a set of four Mk. 22 Type III SRM-6s, as well as the claws on its extremities, themselves impressive close combat weapons for Death from Above attacks and grappling with other 'Mechs in close combat conditions. This combination of melee and short ranged weaponry, heavy armor, and speed (rivaling 'Mechs a third of its tonnage) make the Jade Hawk a powerful close-in fighter and a force to be reckoned with in urban environments. Quirk: Distracting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15 ---- Relatively lightly armed for a heavy BattleMech, the Jade Hawk is equipped only with four Series 1g ER Small Lasers and a set of four Mk. 22 Type III SRM-6s, as well as the claws on its extremities, themselves impressive close combat weapons for Death from Above attacks and grappling with other 'Mechs in close combat conditions. column2: DOA's support model, JHK-04 drops the jump jets, partial wing, advanced myomers and supercharger in exchange for a pair of torso-mounted Streak LRM-15 launchers imported from the Sea Foxes. Three tons of reloads allow the pilot a decent combat radius, while the addition of IS-spec Heavy Duty Gyro and switch to Ferro-Fibrous armor offers a modest boost in protection. column2: Clan Jade Falcon's version of the Jade Hawk is purely Clan-spec and lacks the advanced myomers and claws of the DOA JHK-03 model, carrying four Streak SRM-6 launchers instead of the standard models and mounting a Light Active Probe in its head. Four tons of ammo give the design excellent endurance despite the large number of launchers, while the addition of Ferro-Fibrous plating increases it protection. Quirk: Distracting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15 ---- Clan Jade Falcon's version of the Jade Hawk is purely Clan-spec and lacks the advanced myomers and claws of the DOA JHK-03 model, carrying four Streak SRM-6 launchers instead of the standard models and mounting a Light Active Probe in its head. column2: The second Clan Jade Falcon model trades mobility for raw firepower, removing the jump-jets, wing and supercharger to upgrade two of its arm-mounted lasers to ER Large Lasers and its four SRM launchers to ATM-6s, mounting an additional ER Small Laser as well. Carrying four tons of reloads, generally two tons of standard ATM missiles and one each of Extended Range and High Explosive give it reasonable field endurance. Quirk: Distracting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.17 ---- The second Clan Jade Falcon model trades mobility for raw firepower, removing the jump-jets, wing and supercharger to upgrade two of its arm-mounted lasers to ER Large Lasers and its four SRM launchers to ATM-6s, mounting an additional ER Small Laser as well. column2: Designed in secret by a renegade faction within ComStar is the Kheper is a front line Medium Class BattleMech design intended to be a staple a unit within the secretly resurrected 1st Division of the Com Guard. In the aftermath of the Com Guards' destruction, the Kheper's simple construction and ease of maintenance qualities met with the needs of rebuilding the RAF. After the conflict, the New Earth-based manufacturing center would be seized by Republican forces and the production output would pour into the ranks of the Republic of the Sphere. Quirk: Advanced Optics Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05 ---- Designed in secret by a renegade faction within ComStar is the Kheper is a front line Medium Class BattleMech design intended to be a staple a unit within the secretly resurrected 1st Division of the Com Guard. column2: A Dark Age redesign of the King Crab, the KGC-011 is an unusual take on the classic assault mech. A 400 rated XXL Engine and a Supercharger make the KGC-011 the fastest King Crab to ever walk off of Cosara’s production line. A pair of LB-20X’s and a Plasma Rifle provide a devastating close range punch, whilst a Rocket Launcher acts as a backup weapon should an enemy survive to close in. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18 ---- A Dark Age redesign of the King Crab, the KGC-011 is an unusual take on the classic assault mech. column2: A Light Clan OmniMech, the 30 ton Kit Fox was introduced in 2890 by Clan Cloud Cobra. Favouring a mix of fire power and armor over speed, the Kit Fox is powered by a 180 XL Engine and features a mix of Endo Steel and Ferro Fibrous; giving it 16 tons of pod space. The Kit Fox BLO is armed with a UAC/10, an ER Medium Laser and an ER Small Laser. C3i rounds out the variant. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99 ---- A Light Clan OmniMech, the 30 ton Kit Fox was introduced in 2890 by Clan Cloud Cobra. column2: Designed as a replacement to the Timber Wolf, the 65 ton Linebacker entered production in 3052. Built around a 390 rated XL Engine, the Linebacker’s faster speed enables it to keep up with lighter star mates in running battles, something the Timber Wolf struggled to do. A combination of Ferro Fibrous armor and Endo Steel give the OmniMech 17.5 tons of free pod space. The Linebacker LBK-I is armed with an ER Large Laser and 4 Machine Gun Arrays. Quirk: Stable Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1 ---- Designed as a replacement to the Timber Wolf, the 65 ton Linebacker entered production in 3052. Built around a 390 rated XL Engine, the Linebacker’s faster speed enables it to keep up with lighter star mates in running battles, something the Timber Wolf struggled to do. A combination of Ferro Fibrous armor and Endo Steel give the OmniMech 17.5 tons of free pod space. The Linebacker LBK-I is armed with an ER Large Laser and 4 Machine Gun Arrays. Quirk: Stable Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

column2: With the success of the Mad Cat Mk II design Clan Diamond Shark developed the Mad Cat III as a medium 'Mech to accompany the heavy Mad Cat and assault Mad Cat II. Intended for sale to both Inner Sphere and Clan customers, it has been shunned by the Clans save for the Nova Cats and Exiled Wolves as '...an outrage against everything Nicholas Kerensky stood for and taught us.' However, it has proven popular with the Successor States. Quirk: Improved Communications Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15 ---- With the success of the Mad Cat Mk II design Clan Diamond Shark developed the Mad Cat III as a medium 'Mech to accompany the heavy Mad Cat and assault Mad Cat II. column2: Appearing in 3012, the Marauder II is a redesign of the classic Marauder, turning the 75 ton Heavy Mech into a 100 ton Assault. Originally a Wolfs Dragoons exclusive Mech, it wasn’t until after the 4th War of Succession in 3030 that the Mech would spread beyond the Dragoons. Powered by a 400 rated XL Engine, the Marauder II MAD-10D is armed with a Large Re-Engineered Laser, paired Can ER PPC’s and Medium X-Pulses. column2: A Dark Age rebuild of the Mauler, the Mauler 4K is a Kuritan update of the older 3R variant. Designed as a heavy brawler and urban assault unit, the Mauler 4K swaps the LRM-20’s of the 3K for Apollo enhanced MRM-30’s and the LB-10X’s for Snub Nose PPC’s. The XL Engine is removed to lower costs and increase durability, though this has resulted in the loss of 3 tons of armour which is seen as an acceptable trade-off. The C3 Slave is retained, allowing the 4K to transmit data which it’s longer range lance mates can take advantage of. 16 DHS keep the 4K cool while 4 tons of MRM ammo in CASE protected bays give the MRM’s plenty to shoot with. Quirk: Distracting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.16 ---- A Dark Age rebuild of the Mauler, the Mauler 4K is a Kuritan update of the older 3R variant. column2: Named for the door guards who serve to ward off evil spirits from a home, the Men Shen is the first OmniMech to come from the Capellan Confederation, it borrows heavily from the Raven BattleMech for its basic design concept. The 'Mech is built on a lightweight Endo Steel chassis and is powered by a vulnerable but light VOX 330 XL Engine that gives it a top speed of 97.2 km/h that is augmented by MASC system allowing the 'Mech to be pushed up to 129.6 km/h in short bursts. The Men Shen comes with eleven tons of armor, giving it a respectable amount of protection. The Men Shen carries on its base chassis a Beagle Active Probe allowing it to serve in a recon role regardless of its configuration. For weapons and equipment the Men Shen has seventeen tons of free pod space. Quirk: Improved Communications Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.95 ---- Named for the door guards who serve to ward off evil spirits from a home, the Men Shen is the first OmniMech to come from the Capellan Confederation, it borrows heavily from the Raven BattleMech for its basic design concept. column2: This Dark Age configuration carries a TSEMP Cannon, two Streak SRM-4s, and two Medium X-Pulse Lasers. A Beagle Active Probe is carried in the center torso, while a MASC system allows it to briefly reach speeds of 120km/h.

column2: A common Light OmniMech, the Mist Lynx is fielded by every Clan since it’s introduction in 2926. A 25 ton mech, the Mist Lynx is powered by a 175 rated XL Engine and is built with a combination of Endo Steel and Ferro Fibrous that gives it a respectable 7.5 tons of pod space. An Active Probe is hardwired into the chassis boosting the Mist Lynx’s effectiveness as a scout. The Mist Lynx I is armed with a Narc Beacon and 5 SRM-2’s. Quirk: Improved Sensors Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99 ---- A common Light OmniMech, the Mist Lynx is fielded by every Clan since it’s introduction in 2926. column2: Designed during the Amaris Civil War as a command Mech, the 95 ton Nightstar would not see production until the chaos of the First Succession War. The Nighstar ceased production a year after it first walked off the factory line and would not see production again until the late 3050’s. Powered by a 285 rated XL Engine, the Nightstar 10D is armed with a pair of Light Gauss Rifles and a pair of Clan ER Large Lasers. A Medium X-Pulse Laser provides extra firepower at close quarters. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.17 ---- Designed during the Amaris Civil War as a command Mech, the 95 ton Nightstar would not see production until the chaos of the First Succession War. column2: A stealth version of the Ostscout, the OST-12R combines a clan ER Large Laser with a Guardian ECM suite, Stealth Armor, a Light fusion engine and the classic 8 side-torso Jump Jets. To free the needed weight the OTT-12R further uses Endo-Composite internal structure. Quirk: Improved Sensors Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05 ---- A stealth version of the Ostscout, the OST-12R combines a clan ER Large Laser with a Guardian ECM suite, Stealth Armor, a Light fusion engine and the classic 8 side-torso Jump Jets. column2: The Ostscout OTT-8J was an attempt to make it better scout with more survivability in the modern battlefields. Extra tons of armor, a Bloodhound Active Probe and an Angel ECM Suite ensures its scouting capabilities and increased survival chance, at the cost of having to fit an XL engine and a Compact Gyro. The only armament is a Mediumn X-Pulse Laser. Quirk: Improved Sensors Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05 ---- The Ostscout OTT-8J was an attempt to make it better scout with more survivability in the modern battlefields. column2: When Kallon Industries reintroduced the Penetrator, they switched to endo steel and reflective armor, allowing the arm weapons to be upgraded to snubnosed PPCs aimed with enhanced actuators. This 'Mech is now quite deadly for its weight.

column2: The Prey Seeker, manufactured by Achernar BattleMechs on Cahokia, was designed to be a high-speed scout and raider; while the Prey Seeker's mission profile speaks to MechWarriors who feel marginalized by the growth of combined-arms warfare, the unusual construction of the arms and the phenomenal speeds the 'Mech can reach echo the Dasher OmniMech first seen in the Inner Sphere during the Clan Invasion. column2: The Razorback is a design that excels at little, but is similarly deficient in few areas. hough the design is rather slow for a 'Mech of its size, it is rarely the slowest 'Mech on the field, either. Because of the 'Mech's general reliance on ballistic and missile weaponry, it does not have to worry about overheating under normal circumstances but is dependent on supply trains. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99 ---- The Razorback is a design that excels at little, but is similarly deficient in few areas. hough the design is rather slow for a 'Mech of its size, it is rarely the slowest 'Mech on the field, either. column2: The Sojourner is a simple 'Mech designed by Clan Wolf-in-Exile after the staggering loss at Arc-Royal. The 'Mech went through several design phases resulting in a final design that was both easy to maintain and pilot, with the primary use being to teach younger MechWarriors the trade of 'Mech-on-'Mech combat. As a result the pilots of these 'Mechs have a considerably higher survival rate compared to other, harder to pilot 'Mechs like the Linebacker. The base variant of the Sojourner carries a Gauss Rifle, with the compliment of a single ER Large Laser and a Plasma Cannon. The combination of 3 Jump Jets, a Supercharger and an AES system makes the 'Mech quite mobile on the battlefield despite its somewhat underpowered 240-rated Fusion Core. A CASE II system and a single external Double Heat Sink finishes up the design. Quirk: Easy to Pilot Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09 ---- The Sojourner is a simple 'Mech designed by Clan Wolf-in-Exile after the staggering loss at Arc-Royal. column2: Based on the original Star League-era BattleMech, the Stalker II is a complete top-to-bottom redesign that takes advantage of technological advancements gained since the last era of open warfare ended. These efforts resulted in the Stalker II, giving troops an incredibly durable assault 'Mech that is able to withstand horrific amounts of punishment while keeping the original Stalker's success, which was it's variants that used Star League-era fire control systems. In order to recapture this particular aspect of the old design, the Stalker II was fitted with a modern Targeting Computer. Quirk: Combat Computer Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.21 ---- Based on the original Star League-era BattleMech, the Stalker II is a complete top-to-bottom redesign that takes advantage of technological advancements gained since the last era of open warfare ended. column2: A 55 ton OmniMech that blends a lethal cocktail of speed and firepower, the Stormcrow is a common sight in many clan Toumans. The Stormcrow J is armed with a HAG/30 and an Improved Heavy Large Laser. column2: A sleek, mobile, and versatile design, the Clan Stormcrow was long suspected to be one of the first OmniMechs produced by the Clans. Developed by Clan Snow Raven this variant is unique in that it's intended for vacuum operations. Equipped with an all energy weapon loadout and Laser Heat sinks to cool properly the mech. 4 Improved Jump Jets makes sure the mech can easily maneuver in space. column2: The Summoner is a highly mobile heavy OmniMech that is commonly used in a wide variety of roles. Barely a second generation OmniMech, the Jade Falcons introduced the Summoner just after becoming the first Clan to win OmniMech technology from Clan Coyote in 2863. The main firepower for the J variant is provided by a HAG-40 in the left arm. This is supported by twin Improved Heavy Medium Lasers in the right arm. A Light Active Probe is mounted in the right torso to enhance detection capabilities. Quirk: Improved Communications Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.11 ---- The Summoner is a highly mobile heavy OmniMech that is commonly used in a wide variety of roles. Barely a second generation OmniMech, the Jade Falcons introduced the Summoner just after becoming the first Clan to win OmniMech technology from Clan Coyote in 2863. column2: Hey Boss, the clans call these things the Summoner but I've always called em' the Thor.  These OmniMechs are a tad light on available pod space for their weight class and those early structural mounts are not compatable with anything else. But with that huge engine and lots of jumpjet hardpoints you will be hard pressed to find many 'Mechs its size that are faster.

column2: A Draconis Combine developed Omni mech, the Sunder is based on reverse engineered Loki and Thor Omnimechs. A 360 rated XL Engine allows the omnimech to carry 15 DHS along with 16.5 tons of armor and 36 tons of weapons. The Sunder SD1-OF is armed with 5 Clan LRM-5’s and 6 Thunderbolt-5’s. A Clan ER Medium laser acts as a secondary weapon. Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.11 ---- A Draconis Combine developed Omni mech, the Sunder is based on reverse engineered Loki and Thor Omnimechs. A 360 rated XL Engine allows the omnimech to carry 15 DHS along with 16.5 tons of armor and 36 tons of weapons. The Sunder SD1-OF is armed with 5 Clan LRM-5’s and 6 Thunderbolt-5’s. column2: The Swordsman was an early Federated Suns medium-class BattleMech which was originally built in 2463 as House Davion's third in-house BattleMech design. The design was tainted by heavy use in the Davion Civil War of 2525-2540. Eventually, production ended and the design was relegated to the dustbin of history. However, in the 3060s, the mech was put back into production by House Davion to supplement their forces in the FedCom Civil War. The SWD-2 is the stock production design, mounting heavy armor and firepower for the tonnage: 7.5 tons of armor and a grab-bag mix of guns including an AC/5, LRM-5, SRM-4, two Medium Lasers, and a Small Laser. Quirk: Integrated Searchlight Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.02 ---- The Swordsman was an early Federated Suns medium-class BattleMech which was originally built in 2463 as House Davion's third in-house BattleMech design. The design was tainted by heavy use in the Davion Civil War of 2525-2540. Eventually, production ended and the design was relegated to the dustbin of history. Quirk: Integrated Searchlight Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.02

column2: The Templar III is a Dark Age era Assault Class OmniMech, first produced by General Motors for the Federated Suns. It was intended as a replacement for the original Templar, whose factory lines were destroyed during the Jihad. General Motors established a new production line on New Valencia for what was to become the next generation of the Templar with newer technologies. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1 ---- The Templar III is a Dark Age era Assault Class OmniMech, first produced by General Motors for the Federated Suns. column2: With a noticeable lack of OmniMechs designed in the Federated Suns, Field Marshal Duke George Hasek went over the heads of the Department of the Quartermaster and commissioned Kallon Industries to design an assault OmniMech and backed the project with his own financial resources. The resulting 'Mech is a force to be reckoned with on the modern battlefield. column2: A brutal short-ranged combatant, the Timber Wolf W mounts a mammoth Ultra AC/20 in the right torso, supported by a Streak SRM-6 rack in each side torso, a ER Small Laser in the left torso, and twin ER Medium Lasers in the left arm. Carrying four tons of UAC rounds and single ton of missiles for the ammo efficient Streak launchers, a Supercharger allows the W config to close within optimum range as quickly as possible. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Medium Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.12 ---- A brutal short-ranged combatant, the Timber Wolf W mounts a mammoth Ultra AC/20 in the right torso, supported by a Streak SRM-6 rack in each side torso, a ER Small Laser in the left torso, and twin ER Medium Lasers in the left arm. column2: The Timber Wolf is a fast, heavy OmniMech. A signature design of the Clans' military might, it was arguably the first Clan OmniMech encountered by Inner Sphere forces on The Rock by Phelan Kell. Vaguely resembling a cross-over between the MAD (Marauder) and CAT (Catapult) series, the Timber Wolf was tagged with the Inner Sphere reporting name Mad Cat on first contact. The Z variant is used by Society MechWarriors. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Medium Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1 ---- The Timber Wolf is a fast, heavy OmniMech. column2: The Tomahawk II is designed around the use of a DSAM Endo 10-Composite internal structure, which gives the design its cavernous pod capacity of 56 tons. The 'Mech is powered by a 300-Rated Starfire Extra-Light Fusion Engine, giving it a maximum speed of 54 kph. Protecting the engine and the Tomahawk II's other vitals is 19 tons of Advanced/3 standard armor, providing nearly maximum protection against enemy fire. Quirk: Combat Computer Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.19 ---- The Tomahawk II is designed around the use of a DSAM Endo 10-Composite internal structure, which gives the design its cavernous pod capacity of 56 tons. column2: Produced in 2546, the Toro was the Taurian Concordant’s first battlemech design. Based on captured Firebees, the Toro is a long range support mech. Armed with a PPC and a pair of LRM-5s the Toro carried two tons of ammo and 10 single heat sinks. The last Toro factory was demolished in 2598 by invading Star League troops and production would not resume until the Word of Blake Jihad. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05 ---- Produced in 2546, the Toro was the Taurian Concordant’s first battlemech design. column2: A cheaper alternative to the expensive TBT-9R, the Trebuchet TBT-9N is built around an Endo Steel skeleton, paired with an XL Gyro and a XL Engine. A pair of Clan LRM-15’s are fed by a CASE II protected magazine, while 3 Medium VSPL’s offer a heavy punch at closer ranges. column2: One of the latest UrbanMech variants, the UM-R96 is an evolution of the -R80. It drops all the weaponry bar the Snub-Nose PPC to mount the hardened armor of the -R93 model. The standard small laser remains, although now of the X-pulse variety. This creates an incredibly tough 'Mech with minimal logistics needs, which is perfectly suited to combat in an urban environment—but nowhere else. Quirk: 360° Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99 ---- One of the latest UrbanMech variants, the UM-R96 is an evolution of the -R80. column2: A 30 ton reconnaissance and light fire support Mech, the Valkyrie has been in continuous production since 2787. column2: Introduced in 2940, the Viper is a 40 ton OmniMech that emphasises speed and armour, with only 8.5 tons of podspace available for weapons. column2: A custom configuration used by the Blessed Order's revived First Division's Unending Faith III, the Vulture III BLO carries paired LRM-15 racks in each side torso, supported at short range by the chin-turret mounted ER Medium Lasers, an ER Medium and ER Small Laser in the left arm and an Inner Sphere Light PPC in the right arm. Carrying four tons of LRM reloads, the effectiveness of the BLO is enhanced by the inclusion of an Improved C3 Computer. Quirk: Variable Range Targeting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09 ---- A custom configuration used by the Blessed Order's revived First Division's Unending Faith III, the Vulture III BLO carries paired LRM-15 racks in each side torso, supported at short range by the chin-turret mounted ER Medium Lasers, an ER Medium and ER Small Laser in the left arm and an Inner Sphere Light PPC in the right arm. column2: The primary configuration of the Vulture Mk IV mounts three energy weapons - an Extended Range Particle Projection Cannon in the right arm and a pair of Extended Range Small Pulse Lasers in the center torso's chin turret, a visual quirk introduced in the Vulture Mk. II. A pair of SRM-6s are mounted in each of the left and right torsos, and a single LB 5-X Autocannon left arm rounds out the weapons load. Quirk: Protected Actuators Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09 ---- The primary configuration of the Vulture Mk IV mounts three energy weapons - an Extended Range Particle Projection Cannon in the right arm and a pair of Extended Range Small Pulse Lasers in the center torso's chin turret, a visual quirk introduced in the Vulture Mk. column2: The original Warhammer was designed as an assault BattleMech. However, it had been superseded by later and heavier 'Mech designs, though it remained a powerful weapons platform. The Clans wisely maintained and built on this solid frame a real assault 'Mech, the Warhammer IIC. This version uses an XXL Engine to reach top speeds of 86km/h. Its weapon load hearkens back to the original Warhammer, carrying ER PPCs in the arms and a single ER Medium Laser and ER Small Laser in the left and right torso. An SRM-6 is also carried in the right torso, and an ECM Suite disrupts enemy communications and targeting. This version is protected by Heat-Dissipating Armor. Quirk: Integrated Searchlight Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.24 ---- The original Warhammer was designed as an assault BattleMech. However, it had been superseded by later and heavier 'Mech designs, though it remained a powerful weapons platform. The Clans wisely maintained and built on this solid frame a real assault 'Mech, the Warhammer IIC. This version uses an XXL Engine to reach top speeds of 86km/h. Quirk: Integrated Searchlight Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.24

column2: The original Warhammer was designed as an assault BattleMech. However, it had been superseded by later and heavier 'Mech designs, though it remained a powerful weapons platform. The Clans wisely maintained and built on this solid frame a real assault 'Mech, the Warhammer IIC. Designed by the Raven Alliance, this variant replaces the standard Fusion Core of the IIC-1 with an XL Engine. An LRM-15 is mounted in each side torso with 3 tons of ammo allocated to the launchers. The IIC-13 is otherwise identical to the IIC-1 with the exception of reduced armour. Quirk: Integrated Searchlight Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.2 ---- The original Warhammer was designed as an assault BattleMech. column2: Known and revered across the Inner Sphere and beyond, the Warhammer is the pre-eminent heavy Mech. Debuting in 2515, the 70 ton Mech is a solid blend of firepower and mobility designed to outfight almost any opponent. Powered by a 280 Light Engine and armoured in Ballistic Reinforced armour, the Warhammer WHM-10K is armed with a pair of ER PPC’s. Paired Medium Lasers, ER Small Lasers, Clan Machine Guns and a Streak SRM-6 deter opponents from closing in. Clan DHS and CASE II rounds out the design. Quirk: Integrated Searchlight Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1 ---- Known and revered across the Inner Sphere and beyond, the Warhammer is the pre-eminent heavy Mech. column2: A 20 ton reconnaissance Mech, the Wasp has been in continuous production since it’s introduction in 2471; making it one of the most common Mechs in existence. A Wolf Empire Mech, the Wasp WSP-C is powered by a 120 rated cXL Engine and equipped with 5 Jump Jets. An ER Large Laser is the Mech main weapon, with a Streak SRM-2 for close combat. Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.03 ---- A 20 ton reconnaissance Mech, the Wasp has been in continuous production since it’s introduction in 2471; making it one of the most common Mechs in existence. column2: The Zeus was first built by the Lyran Commonwealth in 2787, just as the First Succession War began. Built at the request of Lyran Commonwealth Armed Forces commanders for a new light-assault 'Mech, the Zeus is fast enough to keep up with most heavy 'Mechs, and is equally capable of defeating them. An evolution of the Zeus -9T, the new ZEU-11S is a mixture of technologies that blurs the Inner Sphere and Clan divide. Using Clan specification extended-range lasers, an extralight engine and LRM 15 launcher built on-site, the -11S seamlessly integrates these onto the frame of the -9T, although mating the Sphere-made Artemis FCS onto the ClanTech launcher did prove to be a challenge. Everything on the -9T was improved, especially armor protection, with the 'Mech's resilience being further bolstered by a compact gyro and CASE II. Quirk: Barrel Fist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14 ---- The Zeus was first built by the Lyran Commonwealth in 2787, just as the First Succession War began. Built at the request of Lyran Commonwealth Armed Forces commanders for a new light-assault 'Mech, the Zeus is fast enough to keep up with most heavy 'Mechs, and is equally capable of defeating them. Using Clan specification extended-range lasers, an extralight engine and LRM 15 launcher built on-site, the -11S seamlessly integrates these onto the frame of the -9T, although mating the Sphere-made Artemis FCS onto the ClanTech launcher did prove to be a challenge. Everything on the -9T was improved, especially armor protection, with the 'Mech's resilience being further bolstered by a compact gyro and CASE II. Quirk: Barrel Fist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

column2: Ah, the Zeus. These fine machines were designed to be a fast light-assault 'Mech capable of a wide variety of roles with its mix of hardpoints and speed. The old joke aside, this is the REAL Steiner Scout 'Mech.

column2: The Adder I config carries an Improved Heavy Medium Laser and twin ER Medium Lasers. An SRM-6 and a ton of ammunition is mounted in each side torso. To handle the heavy heat load, four extra heat sinks are installed, two in each arm. column2: The L configuration is apparently a light striker variant. Each arm carries a pair of Streak LRM-5s and a ton of ammunition. The side torsos carry a single ER Medium Laser, while an ECM Suite provides electronic warfare support. For additional movement, six jump jets are installed for a 180 meter jump range. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.01 ---- The L configuration is apparently a light striker variant. Each arm carries a pair of Streak LRM-5s and a ton of ammunition. column2: The Amazon battle armor was created by the Magistracy of Canopus. Based on the standard Inner Sphere battle armor, the Amazon uses advanced armor to increase protection and provides a jump capability of 90 meters. This allows Amazon-equipped troops to clear obstacles that would stop other battle armor units. The Amazon is used by both the Magistracy and the Capellan Confederation. Amazons deployed by the Capellan Confederation Armed Forces faced Cavalier battle armor and turned in a better performance. Quirk: Armored Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.94 ---- The Amazon battle armor was created by the Magistracy of Canopus. column2: The newest Awesome to walk off of Technicron’s production lines, the Awesome 11H incorporates Technicron’s advances in manufacturing Clantech. column2: This Dark Age version of the Black Knight uses a Light Engine to reach a top speed of 54 km/h. It also has an advanced Endo-Composite skeleton protected by thirteen and a half tons of armor. Seventeen Clan-spec double heat sinks keep heat load under control. The right arm carries a Medium Shield, and it has an advanced Targeting Computer. Its weaponry is all Clan-spec. An ER PPC, two ER Large Lasers, two ER Medium Lasers, two ER Small Lasers and twin Small Pulse Lasers arm the Black Knight. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15 ---- This Dark Age version of the Black Knight uses a Light Engine to reach a top speed of 54 km/h. column2: An upgrade of the Blackjack BattleMech, the Blackjack OmniMech is a powerful and adaptable medium weight workhorse. Much like the Firestarter OmniMech, the genesis of the omni-Blackjack stems from the Combine's technology exchange program during the initial Clan Invasion with Ceres Metals Industries ' St. Ives Compact branch offering Luthien Armor Works specifications and licences to manufacturer the ill-regarded Blackjack. Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99 ---- An upgrade of the Blackjack BattleMech, the Blackjack OmniMech is a powerful and adaptable medium weight workhorse. column2: The Bushwacker was originally a failed BattleMech designed to have a smaller forward profile to make the 'Mech a harder target to hit. The Bushwacker's unique design caused problems with the engine shielding, the side-effects of which manifested themselves as various gremlins in the 'Mech's on board electronics on the prototypes fielded. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05 ---- The Bushwacker was originally a failed BattleMech designed to have a smaller forward profile to make the 'Mech a harder target to hit. column2: The Catapult II retains the original's movement, jump capabilities and has a half ton more armor protection than its predecessor. The Catapult's most notable weapons are its two TSEMP Cannons mounted in the side torsos, which allow it to potentially disable an enemy 'Mech. Serving as back up are more conventional weapons, a pair of Diverse Optics Sunfire Extended Range Medium Lasers that are located in the center torso. A Chameleon Light Polarization Suite is integrated into the chassis aswell. Quirk: Accurate Weapon - Missiles Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14 ---- The Catapult II retains the original's movement, jump capabilities and has a half ton more armor protection than its predecessor. column2: The Catapult II retains the original's movement, jump capabilities and has a half ton more armor protection than its predecessor. Introduced a year after the base model in 3136, the advanced L7L is designed as a more conventional Capellan design with enhanced armor. The 'Mech trades in all its base weaponry for two Plasma Rifles mounted in each of the side torsos, and two 9-tube Multi-Missile Launchers. The design's most noted feature is its Heat-Dissipating Armor, which offers the variant greater resistance to heat related attacks. Quirk: Accurate Weapon - Missiles Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14 ---- The Catapult II retains the original's movement, jump capabilities and has a half ton more armor protection than its predecessor. column2: Based on the Reptar MiltiaMech, the Cazador is a redesigned Clantech upgrade. Sharing the same chassis, the designers took advantage of the Imperios improved manufacturing facilities to fully upgrade the lacklustre MiltitaMech. Replacing the industrial components of the Reptar, the Cazador has a 175 rated Fusion Core and an Endo Steel skeleton, allowing for the installation of a Supercharger. The Cazador is armed with an LB-10X and a pair of Small Pulses Lasers. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04 ---- Based on the Reptar MiltiaMech, the Cazador is a redesigned Clantech upgrade. Sharing the same chassis, the designers took advantage of the Imperios improved manufacturing facilities to fully upgrade the lacklustre MiltitaMech. Replacing the industrial components of the Reptar, the Cazador has a 175 rated Fusion Core and an Endo Steel skeleton, allowing for the installation of a Supercharger. The Cazador is armed with an LB-10X and a pair of Small Pulses Lasers. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04
column3: Cazador представляет собой переработанное и обновлённое в соответствии с технологиями кланов, шасси меха ополчения Reptar. Применив ту же конструкцию разработчики использовали продвинутые производственные мощности Escorpion Imperio, для того чтобы полностью модернизировать нежизнеспособный мех ополчения. В замен промышленных компонентов Reptar были установлены Fusion Core с рейтингом 175 и шасси Endo Steel с возможностью установки Supercharger. Cazador вооружен LB-10X и парой Small Pulses Lasers. Склонность: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

column2: The Centurion OmniMech was born out of a desire on the part of Corean Enterprises to expand the company's market share. Manufactured primarily at the Corean Enterprises' site on New Avalon and weighing in at 50 tons, the Centurion mounted a Magna 250 XL engine, allowing it to run at 86 km/h, and mounts nine and a half tons of standard armor. With ten fixed double heat sinks, the Centurion has 24 tons of pod space available, almost half the total weight of the 'Mech, and the most common variants of the Centurion echo the various variants of the original Centurion BattleMech developed over the centuries. Quirk: Easy to Pilot Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99 ---- The Centurion OmniMech was born out of a desire on the part of Corean Enterprises to expand the company's market share. column2: A Dark Age redesign, the Commando 9S is a long ranged harasser. Based on the earlier 8S model, the 9S replaces the entire weapons loadout. column2: Designed as a successor to the Wolverine, the Conjurer is a 50 ton Mech seen in Clan Second Line formations. Powered by a 250 rated XL Engine, the Conjurer HND-8 mounts 5 Jump jets and MASC. An Inner Sphere RAC/5 makes up the bulk of the HND-8’s weapons, with a pair of Medium Pulse Lasers and a Streak SRM-6 for close combat. column2: Powered by a 200 rated XL Engine and mounting MASC, the 20 ton Fire Moth is one of the fastest Mechs ever created. Designed for scouting and as an Elemental transport, the Fire Moth entered production in 2874. A combination of Ferro Fibrous and Endo Steel give the Fire Moth 7.5 tons of Pod Space. The Fire Moth I is armed with an ER Large Laser, an Improved Heavy Small Laser and an LRM-5. The Fire Moth J is armed with a Plasma Cannon, a Small ER Pulse Laser and a pair of ER Small Lasers. Склонность: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.98

column2: Capable of reaching speeds of 87 km/h with it’s MASC activated, the Executioner is a fast 95 ton Clan OmniMech. Powered by a 380 rated XL Engine, the Executioner has 26.5 tons of pod space. The MASC and 4 Jump Jets are hardwired into the chassis. The Executioner EXE-J is armed with a HAG/40. For shorter ranges, the Executioner J has a trio of SRM-6’s. column2: Originating after the 17th battle of Hesperus II, the Fafnir II is the designation given to a limited production run of custom Fafnir's created with battlefield salvage. Built by Defiance Industries, the 100 ton Fafnir II FNR2-2-CW is powered by a 300 rated Light Engine and protected by 21 tons of Ferro-Lamellor armour. A pair of HAG/30's form the primary armament, with 4 ER Medium Lasers for close range combat. A Targeting Computer improves the Mechs accuracy. Quirk: Stable Weapons Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18 ---- Originating after the 17th battle of Hesperus II, the Fafnir II is the designation given to a limited production run of custom Fafnir's created with battlefield salvage. column2: A Dark Age redesign of the Firebee, the WI-WAM is a Militia Mech deployed by Cappellan planetary defence units. Built with Industrial grade components, the WI-WAM is built around a 105 rated Fuel Cell and is armed with a Thunderbolt 10 and an RL-20. Quirk: Combat Computer Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.73 ---- A Dark Age redesign of the Firebee, the WI-WAM is a Militia Mech deployed by Cappellan planetary defence units. column2: Developed as a complement to the Griffin in the later years of the Jihad, the Ghost is a medium strike 'Mech that saw considerable use in the years after the formation of the Republic of the Sphere. Developed by the Lyran Commonwealth and elements of the former Free Worlds League the Ghost carries an extensive array of electronic warfare equipment into combat. A Beagle Active Probe allows the Ghost to find enemy units, while Stealth Armor and a Guardian ECM Suite allows the 'Mech to live up to its name. With excellent land speed and formidable medium-range weaponry, the Ghost is ideal for hunter-killer and heavy raiding missions, especially when paired with Griffins. Another variant introduced in 3133 removes the SRM-6 rack from the standard Dark Age Ghost and replaces it with a Chainsaw to minimize logistical needs, or potentially to disguise it as an IndustrialMech. Quirk: Improved Sensors Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.06 ---- Developed as a complement to the Griffin in the later years of the Jihad, the Ghost is a medium strike 'Mech that saw considerable use in the years after the formation of the Republic of the Sphere. column2: The Götterdämmerung is a Heavy class BattleMech first fielded by the Lyran Commonwealth in 3138, the 'Mech's German name translates to twilight of the gods or ragnarök. The Götterdämmerung's durability is due in part of layers of Heavy Ferro-Fibrous Armor, while Blackstone would move the cockpit of the 'Mech to the torso. The Torso-Mounted Cockpit's ejection system is highly complex, making escape from the Götterdämmerung difficult under certain circumstances. MechWarriors piloting the 'Mech need also be wary of losing their side torsos, due to the split placement of their life support systems. Quirk: Stable Weapons Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.17 ---- The Götterdämmerung is a Heavy class BattleMech first fielded by the Lyran Commonwealth in 3138, the 'Mech's German name translates to twilight of the gods or ragnarök. column2: The G configurations main purpose is to be mobile enough to scout forward locations and still being able to deal with unexpected infantry troops. To achieve this the pod-based loadout includes 5 Micro Pulse Lasers and 4 Medium Pulse Lasers. The addition of a Watchdog CEWS electronics suite ensures the configuration is able to scout enemy forces without being easily detected. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04 ---- The G configurations main purpose is to be mobile enough to scout forward locations and still being able to deal with unexpected infantry troops. column2: Another configuration focused on maximizing first strike capacity, J mounts 3 Streak SRM6, 2 Improved Heavy Small Lasers and a ER Small Pulse Laser. column2: A refit fielded by the Wolf Empire and sold by the Sea Foxes, the Griffin C is a standardised refit package designed to bring captured Inner Sphere Griffins up to Clan spec. Swapping the standard 275 core for a 330 rated one significantly improves the ground speed and allows for the installation of 9 Improved Jump Jets; virtually doubling the mechs jump range. Swamping the standard PPC for a clan spec ER alternative and the LRM rack for a smaller Streak 10 allows the Griffin to strike at almost any range. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.11 ---- A refit fielded by the Wolf Empire and sold by the Sea Foxes, the Griffin C is a standardised refit package designed to bring captured Inner Sphere Griffins up to Clan spec. column2: The Gùn is a moderately fast light OmniMech which was designed by the Capellan Confederation as an Infantry Support 'Mech. The 'Mech also features a Small Cockpit and an XL Gyro. column2: The first OmniMech both designed and built by the Lyran Alliance. The inspiration for the Hauptmann is drawn from the Daishi OmniMech used by the Clans. Using information from captured Daishis and data gleaned from the construction of the Firestarter OmniMech, which was shared by the Draconis Combine, the end result is a powerful OmniMech capable of defending itself in most combat situations. The Hauptmann is built on a standard chassis and powered by a 285 fusion engine, adding to the 'Mech's durability as it cannot be killed by a side torso loss. The Hauptmann has eleven double heat sinks fixed on the chassis and can add more if needed in its various configurations. For protection, the Hauptmann carries eighteen and a half tons of armor and has CASE fixed in the right torso to protect against an ammunition explosion. Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.12 ---- The first OmniMech both designed and built by the Lyran Alliance. column2: A 3050's era design, the Hecatoncheires is the FWL's attempt to produce a dedicated heavy scout suitable for the modern battlefield. Based on a previously rejected redesign of the venerable Cyclops, the Hecatoncheires downsizes the classic cyclops to 65 tons in weight. A Beagle Active probe, paired with a C3 unit make up the mechs specialist electronics. 4 Medium Lasers and a pair of SRM-6's with Artemis IV provide a nasty punch at close range, while a Gauss Rifle covers longer ranges. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09 ---- A 3050's era design, the Hecatoncheires is the FWL's attempt to produce a dedicated heavy scout suitable for the modern battlefield. column2: Built to command BC3 equipped lances, the Hecatoneires 6Cm is a minor upgrade to the 6C model. The Streak LRM-15 is downsied to a smaller SLRM-10 with the loss of a ton of ammo. The remaining ton is moved to a new ammo bay located below the cockpit, a source of consternation for some pilots. With the freed weight and space, a Boosted C3 Master computer is mounted in the Left torso. column2: A 65 ton design which emphasises overwhelming firepower over speed or armour, the Hellbringer is a Clan OmniMech. Powered by 325 rated Xl Engine, the Hellbringer has 28.5 tons of pod space. AMS protects the Hellbringer T from missiles while CASE II protects the munitions bay. column2: A Nova Cat design, the 50 ton Huntsman was designed for Operation Revival and the invasion of the Inner Sphere; first entering production in 3049. An OmniMech, the Huntsman is built around a 250 rated XL Engine with an Endo Steel Skeleton and Ferro Fibrous armour giving the OmniMech, 21.5 tons of pod space. 5 Jump Jets are fixed to the chassis, giving the Huntsman additional flexibility. The Huntsman E is armed with an Improved Heavy Large Laser and a pair of Artemis V enhanced LRM-15’s. A pair of ER Medium Lasers provide additional firepower at close range. A Targeting Computer enhances the weapons accuaracy. \n\n Quirk: Stable Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05 ---- A Nova Cat design, the 50 ton Huntsman was designed for Operation Revival and the invasion of the Inner Sphere; first entering production in 3049. column2: Relatively lightly armed for a heavy BattleMech, the Jade Hawk is equipped only with four Series 1g ER Small Lasers and a set of four Mk. 22 Type III SRM-6s, as well as the claws on its extremities, themselves impressive close combat weapons for Death from Above attacks and grappling with other 'Mechs in close combat conditions. This combination of melee and short ranged weaponry, heavy armor, and speed (rivaling 'Mechs a third of its tonnage) make the Jade Hawk a powerful close-in fighter and a force to be reckoned with in urban environments. column2: Designed in secret by a renegade faction within ComStar is the Kheper is a front line Medium Class BattleMech design intended to be a staple a unit within the secretly resurrected 1st Division of the Com Guard. In the aftermath of the Com Guards' destruction, the Kheper's simple construction and ease of maintenance qualities met with the needs of rebuilding the RAF. After the conflict, the New Earth-based manufacturing center would be seized by Republican forces and the production output would pour into the ranks of the Republic of the Sphere. column2: A Dark Age redesign of the King Crab, the KGC-011 is an unusual take on the classic assault mech. A 400 rated XXL Engine and a Supercharger make the KGC-011 the fastest King Crab to ever walk off of Cosara’s production line. A pair of LB-20X’s and a Plasma Rifle provide a devastating close range punch, whilst a Rocket Launcher acts as a backup weapon should an enemy survive to close in. column2: Designed as a replacement to the Timber Wolf, the 65 ton Linebacker entered production in 3052. Built around a 390 rated XL Engine, the Linebacker’s faster speed enables it to keep up with lighter star mates in running battles, something the Timber Wolf struggled to do. A combination of Ferro Fibrous armor and Endo Steel give the OmniMech 17.5 tons of free pod space. The Linebacker LBK-I is armed with an ER Large Laser and 4 Machine Gun Arrays. column2: With the success of the Mad Cat Mk II design Clan Diamond Shark developed the Mad Cat III as a medium 'Mech to accompany the heavy Mad Cat and assault Mad Cat II. Intended for sale to both Inner Sphere and Clan customers, it has been shunned by the Clans save for the Nova Cats and Exiled Wolves as '...an outrage against everything Nicholas Kerensky stood for and taught us.' However, it has proven popular with the Successor States. column2: A Dark Age rebuild of the Mauler, the Mauler 4K is a Kuritan update of the older 3R variant. Designed as a heavy brawler and urban assault unit, the Mauler 4K swaps the LRM-20’s of the 3K for Apollo enhanced MRM-30’s and the LB-10X’s for Snub Nose PPC’s. The XL Engine is removed to lower costs and increase durability, though this has resulted in the loss of 3 tons of armour which is seen as an acceptable trade-off. The C3 Slave is retained, allowing the 4K to transmit data which it’s longer range lance mates can take advantage of. 16 DHS keep the 4K cool while 4 tons of MRM ammo in CASE protected bays give the MRM’s plenty to shoot with. Quirk: Distracting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.16 ---- A Dark Age rebuild of the Mauler, the Mauler 4K is a Kuritan update of the older 3R variant. column2: Named for the door guards who serve to ward off evil spirits from a home, the Men Shen is the first OmniMech to come from the Capellan Confederation, it borrows heavily from the Raven BattleMech for its basic design concept. The 'Mech is built on a lightweight Endo Steel chassis and is powered by a vulnerable but light VOX 330 XL Engine that gives it a top speed of 97.2 km/h that is augmented by MASC system allowing the 'Mech to be pushed up to 129.6 km/h in short bursts. The Men Shen comes with eleven tons of armor, giving it a respectable amount of protection. The Men Shen carries on its base chassis a Beagle Active Probe allowing it to serve in a recon role regardless of its configuration. For weapons and equipment the Men Shen has seventeen tons of free pod space. Quirk: Improved Communications Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.95 ---- Named for the door guards who serve to ward off evil spirits from a home, the Men Shen is the first OmniMech to come from the Capellan Confederation, it borrows heavily from the Raven BattleMech for its basic design concept. column2: A common Light OmniMech, the Mist Lynx is fielded by every Clan since it’s introduction in 2926. A 25 ton mech, the Mist Lynx is powered by a 175 rated XL Engine and is built with a combination of Endo Steel and Ferro Fibrous that gives it a respectable 7.5 tons of pod space. An Active Probe is hardwired into the chassis boosting the Mist Lynx’s effectiveness as a scout. The Mist Lynx I is armed with a Narc Beacon and 5 SRM-2’s. Quirk: Improved Sensors Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99 ---- A common Light OmniMech, the Mist Lynx is fielded by every Clan since it’s introduction in 2926. column2: Designed during the Amaris Civil War as a command Mech, the 95 ton Nightstar would not see production until the chaos of the First Succession War. The Nighstar ceased production a year after it first walked off the factory line and would not see production again until the late 3050’s. Powered by a 285 rated XL Engine, the Nightstar 10D is armed with a pair of Light Gauss Rifles and a pair of Clan ER Large Lasers. A Medium X-Pulse Laser provides extra firepower at close quarters. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.17 ---- Designed during the Amaris Civil War as a command Mech, the 95 ton Nightstar would not see production until the chaos of the First Succession War. column2: A stealth version of the Ostscout, the OST-12R combines a clan ER Large Laser with a Guardian ECM suite, Stealth Armor, a Light fusion engine and the classic 8 side-torso Jump Jets. To free the needed weight the OTT-12R further uses Endo-Composite internal structure. Quirk: Improved Sensors Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05 ---- A stealth version of the Ostscout, the OST-12R combines a clan ER Large Laser with a Guardian ECM suite, Stealth Armor, a Light fusion engine and the classic 8 side-torso Jump Jets. column2: The Ostscout OTT-8J was an attempt to make it better scout with more survivability in the modern battlefields. Extra tons of armor, a Bloodhound Active Probe and an Angel ECM Suite ensures its scouting capabilities and increased survival chance, at the cost of having to fit an XL engine and a Compact Gyro. The only armament is a Mediumn X-Pulse Laser. Quirk: Improved Sensors Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05 ---- The Ostscout OTT-8J was an attempt to make it better scout with more survivability in the modern battlefields. column2: The Prey Seeker, manufactured by Achernar BattleMechs on Cahokia, was designed to be a high-speed scout and raider; while the Prey Seeker's mission profile speaks to MechWarriors who feel marginalized by the growth of combined-arms warfare, the unusual construction of the arms and the phenomenal speeds the 'Mech can reach echo the Dasher OmniMech first seen in the Inner Sphere during the Clan Invasion. column2: The Razorback is a design that excels at little, but is similarly deficient in few areas. hough the design is rather slow for a 'Mech of its size, it is rarely the slowest 'Mech on the field, either. Because of the 'Mech's general reliance on ballistic and missile weaponry, it does not have to worry about overheating under normal circumstances but is dependent on supply trains. column2: The Sojourner is a simple 'Mech designed by Clan Wolf-in-Exile after the staggering loss at Arc-Royal. The 'Mech went through several design phases resulting in a final design that was both easy to maintain and pilot, with the primary use being to teach younger MechWarriors the trade of 'Mech-on-'Mech combat. As a result the pilots of these 'Mechs have a considerably higher survival rate compared to other, harder to pilot 'Mechs like the Linebacker. The base variant of the Sojourner carries a Gauss Rifle, with the compliment of a single ER Large Laser and a Plasma Cannon. The combination of 3 Jump Jets, a Supercharger and an AES system makes the 'Mech quite mobile on the battlefield despite its somewhat underpowered 240-rated Fusion Core. A CASE II system and a single external Double Heat Sink finishes up the design. column2: Based on the original Star League-era BattleMech, the Stalker II is a complete top-to-bottom redesign that takes advantage of technological advancements gained since the last era of open warfare ended. These efforts resulted in the Stalker II, giving troops an incredibly durable assault 'Mech that is able to withstand horrific amounts of punishment while keeping the original Stalker's success, which was it's variants that used Star League-era fire control systems. In order to recapture this particular aspect of the old design, the Stalker II was fitted with a modern Targeting Computer. Quirk: Combat Computer Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.21 ---- Based on the original Star League-era BattleMech, the Stalker II is a complete top-to-bottom redesign that takes advantage of technological advancements gained since the last era of open warfare ended. column2: The Summoner is a highly mobile heavy OmniMech that is commonly used in a wide variety of roles. Barely a second generation OmniMech, the Jade Falcons introduced the Summoner just after becoming the first Clan to win OmniMech technology from Clan Coyote in 2863. The main firepower for the J variant is provided by a HAG-40 in the left arm. This is supported by twin Improved Heavy Medium Lasers in the right arm. A Light Active Probe is mounted in the right torso to enhance detection capabilities. column2: The Swordsman was an early Federated Suns medium-class BattleMech which was originally built in 2463 as House Davion's third in-house BattleMech design. The design was tainted by heavy use in the Davion Civil War of 2525-2540. Eventually, production ended and the design was relegated to the dustbin of history. However, in the 3060s, the mech was put back into production by House Davion to supplement their forces in the FedCom Civil War. The SWD-2 is the stock production design, mounting heavy armor and firepower for the tonnage: 7.5 tons of armor and a grab-bag mix of guns including an AC/5, LRM-5, SRM-4, two Medium Lasers, and a Small Laser. Quirk: Integrated Searchlight Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.02 ---- The Swordsman was an early Federated Suns medium-class BattleMech which was originally built in 2463 as House Davion's third in-house BattleMech design. Quirk: Integrated Searchlight Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.02

column2: The Templar III is a Dark Age era Assault Class OmniMech, first produced by General Motors for the Federated Suns. It was intended as a replacement for the original Templar, whose factory lines were destroyed during the Jihad. General Motors established a new production line on New Valencia for what was to become the next generation of the Templar with newer technologies. column2: With a noticeable lack of OmniMechs designed in the Federated Suns, Field Marshal Duke George Hasek went over the heads of the Department of the Quartermaster and commissioned Kallon Industries to design an assault OmniMech and backed the project with his own financial resources. The resulting 'Mech is a force to be reckoned with on the modern battlefield. column2: A missile boat configuration, the Timber Wolf T is armed with an Artemis V FCS-enhanced LRM-20 rack in each side torso, supported by a Improved Heavy Medium Laser and ER Medium Laser in each arm and a pair of ER Small Lasers and a single ER Small Pulse Laser in the torsos. Six tons of LRM rounds and two extra double heat sinks give it good field endurance. Quirk: Artemis V Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.12 ---- A missile boat configuration, the Timber Wolf T is armed with an Artemis V FCS-enhanced LRM-20 rack in each side torso, supported by a Improved Heavy Medium Laser and ER Medium Laser in each arm and a pair of ER Small Lasers and a single ER Small Pulse Laser in the torsos. column2: A brutal short-ranged combatant, the Timber Wolf W mounts a mammoth Ultra AC/20 in the right torso, supported by a Streak SRM-6 rack in each side torso, a ER Small Laser in the left torso, and twin ER Medium Lasers in the left arm. Carrying four tons of UAC rounds and single ton of missiles for the ammo efficient Streak launchers, a Supercharger allows the W config to close within optimum range as quickly as possible. column2: The Timber Wolf is a fast, heavy OmniMech. A signature design of the Clans' military might, it was arguably the first Clan OmniMech encountered by Inner Sphere forces on The Rock by Phelan Kell. Vaguely resembling a cross-over between the MAD (Marauder) and CAT (Catapult) series, the Timber Wolf was tagged with the Inner Sphere reporting name Mad Cat on first contact. The Z variant is used by Society MechWarriors. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Medium Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1 ---- The Timber Wolf is a fast, heavy OmniMech. column2: The Tomahawk II is designed around the use of a DSAM Endo 10-Composite internal structure, which gives the design its cavernous pod capacity of 56 tons. The 'Mech is powered by a 300-Rated Starfire Extra-Light Fusion Engine, giving it a maximum speed of 54 kph. Protecting the engine and the Tomahawk II's other vitals is 19 tons of Advanced/3 standard armor, providing nearly maximum protection against enemy fire. column2: Produced in 2546, the Toro was the Taurian Concordant’s first battlemech design. Based on captured Firebees, the Toro is a long range support mech. Armed with a PPC and a pair of LRM-5s the Toro carried two tons of ammo and 10 single heat sinks. The last Toro factory was demolished in 2598 by invading Star League troops and production would not resume until the Word of Blake Jihad. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05 ---- Produced in 2546, the Toro was the Taurian Concordant’s first battlemech design. column2: A cheaper alternative to the expensive TBT-9R, the Trebuchet TBT-9N is built around an Endo Steel skeleton, paired with an XL Gyro and a XL Engine. A pair of Clan LRM-15’s are fed by a CASE II protected magazine, while 3 Medium VSPL’s offer a heavy punch at closer ranges. column2: Don't let the stubby 'Urbie' fool you—it may look like a walking trash can, but it mounts hardened armour and a plasma cannon. R93s aren't known for their speed, but they are very useful if you can draw the enemy into their firing range. column2: One of the latest UrbanMech variants, the UM-R96 is an evolution of the -R80. It drops all the weaponry bar the Snub-Nose PPC to mount the hardened armor of the -R93 model. The standard small laser remains, although now of the X-pulse variety. This creates an incredibly tough 'Mech with minimal logistics needs, which is perfectly suited to combat in an urban environment—but nowhere else. Quirk: 360° Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99 ---- One of the latest UrbanMech variants, the UM-R96 is an evolution of the -R80. column2: A 30 ton reconnaissance and light fire support Mech, the Valkyrie has been in continuous production since 2787. column2: A custom configuration used by the Blessed Order's revived First Division's Unending Faith III, the Vulture III BLO carries paired LRM-15 racks in each side torso, supported at short range by the chin-turret mounted ER Medium Lasers, an ER Medium and ER Small Laser in the left arm and an Inner Sphere Light PPC in the right arm. Carrying four tons of LRM reloads, the effectiveness of the BLO is enhanced by the inclusion of an Improved C3 Computer. column2: The primary configuration of the Vulture Mk IV mounts three energy weapons - an Extended Range Particle Projection Cannon in the right arm and a pair of Extended Range Small Pulse Lasers in the center torso's chin turret, a visual quirk introduced in the Vulture Mk. column2: The original Warhammer was designed as an assault BattleMech. However, it had been superseded by later and heavier 'Mech designs, though it remained a powerful weapons platform. The Clans wisely maintained and built on this solid frame a real assault 'Mech, the Warhammer IIC. This version uses an XXL Engine to reach top speeds of 86km/h. Its weapon load hearkens back to the original Warhammer, carrying ER PPCs in the arms and a single ER Medium Laser and ER Small Laser in the left and right torso. An SRM-6 is also carried in the right torso, and an ECM Suite disrupts enemy communications and targeting. This version is protected by Heat-Dissipating Armor. Quirk: Integrated Searchlight Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.24 ---- The original Warhammer was designed as an assault BattleMech. However, it had been superseded by later and heavier 'Mech designs, though it remained a powerful weapons platform. The Clans wisely maintained and built on this solid frame a real assault 'Mech, the Warhammer IIC. Designed by the Raven Alliance, this variant replaces the standard Fusion Core of the IIC-1 with an XL Engine. An LRM-15 is mounted in each side torso with 3 tons of ammo allocated to the launchers. The IIC-13 is otherwise identical to the IIC-1 with the exception of reduced armour. column2: Known and revered across the Inner Sphere and beyond, the Warhammer is the pre-eminent heavy Mech. Debuting in 2515, the 70 ton Mech is a solid blend of firepower and mobility designed to outfight almost any opponent. Powered by a 280 Light Engine and armoured in Ballistic Reinforced armour, the Warhammer WHM-10K is armed with a pair of ER PPC’s. Paired Medium Lasers, ER Small Lasers, Clan Machine Guns and a Streak SRM-6 deter opponents from closing in. Clan DHS and CASE II rounds out the design. The addition of energy weapons frees the Yeoman from the ammunition dependencies that plagued the earlier models. column2: The Zeus was first built by the Lyran Commonwealth in 2787, just as the First Succession War began. Built at the request of Lyran Commonwealth Armed Forces commanders for a new light-assault 'Mech, the Zeus is fast enough to keep up with most heavy 'Mechs, and is equally capable of defeating them. An evolution of the Zeus -9T, the new ZEU-11S is a mixture of technologies that blurs the Inner Sphere and Clan divide. Using Clan specification extended-range lasers, an extralight engine and LRM 15 launcher built on-site, the -11S seamlessly integrates these onto the frame of the -9T, although mating the Sphere-made Artemis FCS onto the ClanTech launcher did prove to be a challenge. Everything on the -9T was improved, especially armor protection, with the 'Mech's resilience being further bolstered by a compact gyro and CASE II. Quirk: Barrel Fist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14 ---- The Zeus was first built by the Lyran Commonwealth in 2787, just as the First Succession War began. Built at the request of Lyran Commonwealth Armed Forces commanders for a new light-assault 'Mech, the Zeus is fast enough to keep up with most heavy 'Mechs, and is equally capable of defeating them. Everything on the -9T was improved, especially armor protection, with the 'Mech's resilience being further bolstered by a compact gyro and CASE II. Quirk: Barrel Fist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14
